/-- The normal closure of $(04)(13)$ within $A_5$ is the whole group. This will be

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Equiv

/-!
We formalize the statement: for n ≥ 2, let α = (0 1) and β = (0 1 ... n-1) in Sym (Fin n).
Then for any 1 < i < n the transposition (i, i+1) is the conjugate
β^(i-1) * α * β^{-(i-1)}.

We state a version using Fin: for any i : Fin n with i ≠ Fin.last n,
( i, i+1 ) = β^(i.val) * α * β^(-i.val).
The proof is omitted (:= by sorry).
-/

theorem transposition_conjugation {n : ℕ} (hn : 2 ≤ n) (α β : Perm (Fin n)) :
  ∀ (i : Fin n), i ≠ Fin.last n → Equiv.swap i (i + 1) = (β ^ (i.val)) * α * (β ^ (i.val))⁻¹ :=
by
  intro i hi
  -- proof omitted
  sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Equiv

/-- Conjugation of a transposition: for any permutation σ of a Type with decidable equality,
    σ * swap x y * σ⁻¹ = swap (σ x) (σ y).
    This general fact specializes to the statement in the problem when one takes
    σ = β^{i-1}, x = 1, y = 2 (with the appropriate indexing convention).
-/
theorem swap_conj {α : Type _} [DecidableEq α] (σ : Perm α) (x y : α) :
  swap (σ x) (σ y) = σ * swap x y * σ⁻¹ :=
by
  -- proof omitted
  sorry
